definition: a form of military punishment used by the British in the late 17th century in which a soldier was forced to stand on one foot on a pointed stake, fasten with a picket
details:
noun
- a form of military punishment used by the British in the late 17th century in which a soldier was forced to stand on one foot on a pointed stake
= synonyms: piquet
- a wooden strip forming part of a fence
= synonyms: pale
- a vehicle performing sentinel duty
- a detachment of troops guarding an army from surprise attack
- a person employed to keep watch for some anticipated event
= synonyms: watch, lookout, spotter, lookout man, sentinel, sentry, scout
- a protester posted by a labor organization outside a place of work
verb
- fasten with a picket
= example: fasten with a picket
- serve as pickets or post pickets
= example: serve as pickets or post pickets
